subject: Re: [junit] JUnit4: assertEquals(int, int) gives different exception from assertEquals(String,String)
msgSnippet: Jon, ComparisonFailure is especially for string comparisons: many runners (including Eclipse and textui) like to be able to get at the actual string
messageBody:
Jon,

ComparisonFailure is especially for string comparisons: many runners
(including Eclipse and textui) like to be able to get at the actual
string differences and show the difference in a special way.

David Saff

Jon Skeet wrote:

> While developing the parameterised test extension for JUnit4, I've
> currently got two tests in a broken state (yes, I know).
>
> Both are using Assert.assertEquals - but one (the pair of ints) ends up
> failing with a java.lang.AssertionError, whereas the pair of strings
> ends up failing with a junit.framework.ComparisonFailure.
>
> Obviously, both are test failures, and both have reasonable messages -
> but is there any reason for the inconsistency here?
>
> Jon Skeet
